revised_title: Investigating the Composition of Carbonated Hydrogenous Gas
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine whether carbon is a simple or compound substance by analyzing carbonated hydrogenous gas. They found that the gas contains a mixture of carbonic acid and azotic gas, and that the expansion of the gas by electricity does not indicate a decomposition of charcoal. This research contributes to the understanding of the composition and properties of carbon compounds.
